Class Converter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Converter

  • public class Converter
extends java.lang.Object
    Converter class implements the interface for receiving user input in the form of a dollar amount below $1000 and converting the number to natural language
    Author:
    conorhenry

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String[] DECADES
      Constant array of strings representing the names of decades from 20 to 90
      private java.lang.String decimal
      The decimal part of the number that is to be converted, as a string
      private static java.lang.String[] DIGITS
      Constant array of strings representing the names of single digit numbers
      private static java.lang.String[] IRREGULARS
      Constant array of strings representing the names of number between 10 and 19
      private java.lang.Integer number
      The integer part of the number which is to be converted
      private java.lang.StringBuilder result
      StringBuilder object for returning the result

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Converter()
      Constructor for converter class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String convert()
      Convert method takes the number provided by user and returns a string representing the specified number in the form (ex) " ONE hundred TWELVE and 34/100 "

    • Constructor Detail

      • Converter

        public Converter()
        Constructor for converter class. Takes input from the user to get the number to be converted, and parses it into integer and decimal sections.

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        public java.lang.String convert()
        Convert method takes the number provided by user and returns a string representing the specified number in the form (ex) " ONE hundred TWELVE and 34/100 "
        Returns:
        a string representing the specified number in the form (ex) " ONE hundred TWELVE and 34/100 "
